Travel_History_Narrative: History of Travel Narrative: Mr. Lundquist427 is a 62-year-old male who resides in Charleston, WI. His recent travel history includes routine daily activities within his hometown on May 9, 2024. Prior to that, he traveled to Milwaukee, WI from April 21-25, 2024 for a business conference and training sessions related to his occupation as an electrician. He stayed at the Hyatt Regency Milwaukee hotel during this trip. Both of these trips involved travel by personal vehicle. There is no reported travel outside of Wisconsin in the available records.

Encounter_Details.Chief Complaint: Follow-up after completing hepatitis C treatment

Practitioner_Documents.Reason for Visit: Follow-up after completing hepatitis C treatment
Practitioner_Documents.Past Medical History: Mr. Lundquist427 is a 62-year-old male with a past medical history significant for chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, genotype 1a. He was diagnosed with HCV in 2015 after routine bloodwork revealed elevated liver enzymes. Risk factors included a history of intravenous drug use in his youth. He underwent treatment with ledipasvir/sofosbuvir for 12 weeks in 2023 and achieved a sustained virologic response (SVR) at 12 weeks post-treatment. He has no other significant past medical history.
Practitioner_Documents.Review of Systems: A review of systems was performed and was negative except for the following: General: Denies fever, chills, fatigue, or weight changes. HEENT: Denies headaches, vision changes, or sore throat. Respiratory: Denies cough, shortness of breath, or wheezing. Cardiovascular: Denies chest pain, palpitations, or edema. Gastrointestinal: Denies abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or constipation. Genitourinary: Denies dysuria, hematuria, or urinary frequency. Musculoskeletal: Denies joint pain or swelling. Skin: Denies rashes or pruritus. Neurological: Denies dizziness, weakness, or numbness. Psychiatric: Denies anxiety, depression, or sleep disturbances.
Practitioner_Documents.History of Present Illness: Mr. Lundquist427 is a 62-year-old male who presents for follow-up after completing treatment for chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection. He reports feeling well and denies any new symptoms. He completed a 12-week course of ledipasvir/sofosbuvir in January 2023 and achieved a sustained virologic response (SVR) at 12 weeks post-treatment, with an undetectable HCV viral load. He has been adherent with follow-up appointments and laboratory monitoring. His most recent liver function tests and complete blood count were within normal limits. He denies any new risk factors for HCV transmission.
Practitioner_Documents.Plan of Treatment: 1. Continued monitoring for potential HCV relapse with HCV viral load testing every 6 months for the next 2 years. 2. Annual liver function tests and complete blood count to monitor for liver disease progression. 3. Counseling on risk factor avoidance and prevention of HCV transmission. 4. Referral to hepatology for consideration of treatment-related cirrhosis screening and surveillance. 5. Encourage routine age-appropriate cancer screening and preventive care. 6. Follow-up in 6 months or sooner if any new concerning symptoms develop.
Practitioner_Documents.Vaccine Credential Patient Assertion: Patient reports being up-to-date on routine adult vaccinations, including influenza and pneumococcal vaccines. He declines COVID-19 vaccination at this time.

Lab_Entries.LOINC Order Code Description: Hepatitis C virus RNA [Presence] in Serum or Plasma by NAT with probe detection
Alanine aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma
Aspartate aminotransferase [Enzymatic activity/Volume] in Serum or Plasma

Diagnosis_Entries.Diagnosis: Chronic viral hepatitis C, sustained virologic response

Procedure_Entries.Details: Quantitative real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) assay for detection and quantification of hepatitis C virus RNA in serum or plasma.

Procedure_Entries.Procedure Description: Antiviral therapy for hepatitis C virus
Procedure_Entries.Details: 12-week course of ledipasvir/sofosbuvir (Harvoni) for treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus infection, genotype 1a.
Measurement of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) to assess liver function.
Screening ultrasound of the liver and abdominal organs to evaluate for cirrhosis or other complications of chronic hepatitis C.

Medication_Entries.Purpose: Treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus infection
Medication_Entries.Dose: 90 mg ledipasvir/400 mg sofosbuvir once daily
Medication_Entries.Response Details: Undetectable hepatitis C virus RNA at 12 weeks post-treatment completion

Medication_Entries.Purpose: Treatment of mild pain or fever as needed
Medication_Entries.Response Details: Reported relief of mild headaches or muscle aches during antiviral treatment course

Medication_Entries.Purpose: Prophylaxis for gastric acid suppression during antiviral treatment
Medication_Entries.Response Details: No reported gastrointestinal side effects during antiviral treatment course
No reported adverse reactions or influenza illness during the 2023-2024 influenza season
No reported pneumococcal infections since vaccination

Case_Summary.Summary: This is a fictional representation of healthcare data intended for interoperability testing and solution development. The data are entirely fictitious and do not represent a real person or a real clinical scenario. A 62-year-old white male successfully completed antiviral therapy for chronic hepatitis C in 2023, achieving sustained virologic response. He remains asymptomatic with regular monitoring for potential relapse. The clinical course reflects excellent treatment response and prognosis.
